column5: My stepson found me one in Burlington, there telescopic. Thanks guys
Count me in Cudz, sounds like a good time!!!
I can't wait to try the rod and reel in the down rigger Salmon fishing. I think safety glasses will be a must.
I checked back and I see Cudz mentioned a rod too. When I was at Dollarama today I only saw a reel. $2 for the reel.
The rods are telescopic and green in colour.  THey are $2
Dollarama jerkbaits baby!
i can go if some one picks me up ill spilt gas
Can't Wait
Just look for the items billed at a buck.  JF
Or a scattershield.  JF

I'm ready and waiting for this...  :D for those that cannot fish any G2G, maybe all pic's must have a REAL time stamp on them? is the last week of Aug. good for everyone?  Just before the long weekend (and inc. the long weekend) so the folks limited to shore have a full week to fish, is this OK? OH yeah, red and yellow spinner bait and silver top water here I come...  or am I messing with you...
Ya know what, I think Cudz should get one for such a great idea.  even more so if we get this off the ground and set up as an event!  HAHAHA
Those dates are fine with me.
Great idea.. we can all chip in!!
Oooh, that came back to bite ya pretty quick, GBW!
next time I'm in Barrie I'll get him an XL coffee then...
I KNEW IT!!!
DUDE!!!.. you look like Joe Schmitt the Rag Man!!!
ohhh look out, I found what I needed today and spent only $9.00 + taxes...    humm, I wonder what I should get with that last buck...
This sounds like so much fun, I'd so be in if my Wife's due date wasn't Sept 1st..
you can fish when ever you can with the gear, just post picks of you fishing with it and show the fish with said $rama bait still in it's mouth.  I'll be testing it out this weekend...
I got two tonite.. lol.. ill post soon.
Got some of my stuff, blew the budget $2.00 for the reel, but still looking for the rod. Any one know the Dollar store that has the Rod?
Lots of them in North London Dollarama
Thanks ChrisK, I'm in Hamilton. I hope I can find one in that area.
None at Grimsby or St Kitts. I've asked if I can bodge one from a willow or maple whip, like we did as kids.

They do sell leaders there as well but not the ones SNAG has on his spinners.  I will be looking very close at the pics as well. **No catching fish with your normal rod and reel and then putting the dollarama rig in the pic.  This has to be legit and honest.

I am SOOO ready to go out and get some gear for this, HAHAHAHA!  TJ and any other Admin's and MOD's, want anyone to post a poll or you make this a "sticky" thread about this while it get's worked out?

Damn the Fort Erie D-ram only has the reel and a few lures....no hooks, rods, sinkers etc. I will have to check out the Niagara Falls one.  If I'm able to make the date that's selected, boat spots are available, and people are willing to split on gas...I can take at least 4 people in my minivan!
Dollarama bamboo pole. It came with line, a hook, a weight and a float. I did not buy the canned sweetcorn there as they were all out.       Forgot to ad this was last year.

There are 4 dollaramas in Barrie.  I know that 2 of the stores have the cane poles.  One store has a rod reel combo for $2 and the other has a telescopic rod for $2 and reels for $1.25 I think.  I think I am going to get the telespcopic rod.  It looks the strongest.  Not that it matters, I think the reel will be the week link.  Apart from the wire bail I didn`t anything but plastic on it.
I'm gunna check the one in town and try to get in on this, and if I'm gunna spend the money, I'm gunna use it and not cheat.

I was just in a Dollarama the other day and I think the telescopic rod is $2 and the reel is another $2. That will leave you 6 bucks for dollar spam for bait and lures. I could be wrong though...  I do have a few Dollarama lures and they have worked. My son actually picked up a $2 rod back in the spring because he just couldn't say no to it, I rigged it up with an old 1970's Mitchel 300 reel but none of us has tried it yet.  Your dollar derby idea sounds like a good plan.
You could maybe post a picture of your fish, on a Dollarama lure, showing also the Dollarama reel and the front page of the current day's newspaper, posted to the site before, say, midnight.

"  If we don`t have a Dollarama thread we can just post reports with Dollarama in the title.  Attention Moderators >>>>> see above >>>>>  Please give us a sticky to start this...    "If we really want to do this right we should spend an extra $10 and go to goodwill at the same time and get some sweet swag to accompany our sweet fishing tackle."  Hmmmm.. .why do you think i "need" to spend another $10.00 on some new "swag"... the missus says I look like a redneck already
Sounds like a fun idea folks. Just got to round up the other mods and have a pow wow....
I've waited my whole life for this moment.

How about a "regional" thing?  Ie: Southwestern Ontario (519 area code- Kitchener down to Windsor)  GTA (416 & 905 area codes)  Eastern Ontario ( Oshawa and east)  Northern ( 705 area code -Barrie and north of there)  All other members, from outside of Ontario, can join in the region of their choice.   Any thoughts ?  Splashhopper and Botbot
Should we contact Dollarama for some "prizes" ?  Oh,,, i really wanna win that kewl hat and mitt combo for my hike into the trout locations this fall
Not fair. You've been researching the Dollarama lures and practicing with them. There should be a 10% penalty for "experts" or at least have a Pro's Division & one for us Rookies.  JF

I picked these up this morning...    There was a whole rack of them, and I don't think any two lures were alike.  Couldn't quite get myself to spring for the $2 reel though. I like bargains for tackle but that one kinda stuck in my craw... for now anyway.  The lures look like they might last through a fish or two but the reel looks like it would be a real challenge to catch anything with! (Just the kind of thing for a fun derby, though --- might make for some great stories!)

I tell ya what!!  I just pinned this.. cause I think this is a great idea.  If you guys get this G2G going, I will definitely get some prizes together, Starting off with some subway gift cards, and OFC apparel.  As a matter of fact.. Ill donate a jacket to the winner... Kinda like this one...    Lets get some rules finalized and a date and place!!

I bougth two lures today as well but they are WAY BETTER than yours.  I am writing up some rules and regs and I will post them here in my first post when I get them done.  If you have any changes you would like seen the rules let me know.  I will have them a little later today.  I have to go play with my kids.
Aw damn! Did I get the wrong colours???  Hey, did you notice? They're rattlin' lures! Now that's quality at a bargain basement price!
I'm excited!!  Can't wait to see some details, hopefully its not a week I'm working midnights!
I need to get to my local Drama, and see if they have any fishing stuff !!!  What do you think about keeping the receipts.... just to make it more official ! haha
Deffinately receipts & packaging!  If its a G2G I don't think anyone is going to cheat....but I will want to do some fishing on real gear if I'm travelling up to Barrie.
If we make it a board wide thing, I can gather up more prizes..  and yes reciepts are necessary..  and no one would cheat!!
I don't think Dollarama receipts show the items, do they?
ROFL  that is a VERY good point...its just 1.00 1.00 1.00 2.00 1.00 lol
Oh Boy, George! We is going to have a grand old time, we are.

I am seriously thinking of having a dollarama derby.  The night before we go to Dollarama and can only spend $10 (including rod and reel).  You can't use anything but dollarama stuff and we have a fishing tourney. There is a good assortment of spinners, spoons, cranks, and poppers to choose from.  No live bait allowed but you can use the food from the food section.  Rod and reel is $2 and that leaves $8 for lures.  Should be funny.  I will let you know if we get this off the ground.  I wonder how long the reel will last?  Maybe 2 fish.
I am 100% down!  Let me know if I can help in any way!
hahaha yea that would be awsome !
SICK!   im all in  haha
Are you like a genius or something Cudz?  Cuz thats an awesome idea!!
2 dollar rod and reel??????
LOL.. thats a great idea!!
buh hahaha oh man i'm in

For OFNers only? That would be an interesting G2G. We'd be forced to drink a lot to overcome the embarrassment of using cheesy gear - and getting our butts kicked by newbies - - -  Oh wait! Newby - that's me!  Hey! This is a great idea. We all start off on an equal footing with no $300 rods that no one can remember the name of, or Kazillion dollar reels that have 47 bearings in the little finger spinner thingies alone, and who knows how many in the real important gutsy parts that most of us don't understand, and line that is priced by the inch and will horse a small whale, and plastic baits that cost more than it would to hand raise the little worms from babyhood, including worm diapers and teeny little soothers.  Hmmmm! Does Dollarama sell Minnkotas, GPS's & hi-def fishfinders? And I suspect that's not a baitcaster or a pin for $1.00. That'll seriously cripple some of these guys if those aren't available.  This is a great idea. But then I'm a kloset kommunist.  JF
great idea!  post when and where and if I can make it I'm in for sure!  HAHAHAHA
I,ll be chartering with the new crib.LOL  No dollarama rates thou.LOL
Awesome!  Bring it on!  I only recommend for the safety of the fish, not to target anything larger than bass.  The rod, reel and line will break otherwise.
I really hope my Dollarama has a fishing section LMAO!
Hit the costume jewelery section for some crazy things you can make lures out of. Seriously.
I'm in!
Sound like fun. Are we using boats? Where would we fish? What kind of rod and reel can you possibly get for $2.00?
Not the kind you use.  JF

Dollarama has fishing gear?  Maybe we could start up a regional thing.... or... a rider for the tourney here... but you have to show the pic of the fish with the actual lure and line attached to it....  ie... Team IntensityDollardaysofsuummer

Oh my!  I visited the dollar store....and yes they have lures as well as 2 dollar reels! LMAO!   I didn't pick up the reel, grabbed a few spinners since they are only a dollar! hahaha.  If this goes down I'll grab the reel, its 100% plastic lol!
im in 100% lets make a site thing to cause lots o us prob cant make it if its somewhere far away like me i bike everywere

I'm cool with the whole "fish when you can idea" about it, but a GTG to get out and see 20+ people out there doing this would be priceless (well $10.00 or less per person but you get the point ). Anyone think that the time from Aug 29 to Sept 7 is a good time?  It is the last week before the kid's head back to school and it cover the long weekend.  I mean, those that cannot do a GTG and have maybe a day or 2 to get out can post the fish with said rod, reel and lure from any days in that time?  And then the others that can make a GTG post those?  these are just ideas as I think this would be too damn funny to see the pic's and see what goes on - on the water with this "gear"....

Ok, so here is the deal.  I would love to have a tourney on Simcoe out of boats but it is probably not going to work.  I was thinking this.  We start a dollarama thread and we all take one day (or a couple of hours in a day, I don`t want to ruin your whole day) and we fish anywhere we want with our dollarama rigs.  When we catch a fish on our dollarama gear (IT MUST BE ALL DOLLARAMA INCLUDING ROD REEL LINE SINKERS HOOKS LURES ETC) we post pics.  Rod and reel in hand and bait in mouth if possible.  No live bait.  Just dollarama stuff.  If we don`t have a dollarama thread we can just post reports with dollarama in the title. I am buying my rod and reel tomorrow (be careful some already look broken in the packages LOL)  Looks like snag has already got a leg up on the competition.  I remember last year a bunch of blue fox and YUM stuff was on sale at dollarama.  They have a 15 piece jig set there as well as some nice hardbaits, lol.  I will buy some hooks and weights and drop shot for some trophy Simcoe smallies.  If we really want to do this right we should spend an extra $10 and go to goodwill at the same time and get some sweet swag to accompany our sweet fishing tackle.
one problem is i dont have a car and i cant get to simcoe
HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHA, wait I don't need to...      all my old stuff is at the cottage and I use it all the time as my fishing gear, can I get an extra $10 at rama then?  LOL!
I know I'll be looking for SNAG's post's and checking the line that it's not braid or 50LB floro...
